thread.title: SCFD rejects appeal to give more to smaller arts groups
thread.title_full: SCFD rejects appeal to give more to smaller arts groups - The Denver Post

author: Ray Mark Rinaldi
title: SCFD rejects appeal to give more to smaller arts groups
text:
The SCFD board of directors Thursday took a step toward ending the debate over how public arts funding should be distributed in the region Thursday, reaffirming a plan it previously approved in May.
Scores of arts groups have been campaigning for alternate plans that provide more money to small- and mid-sized arts groups, giving them a bigger share of a pot that goes mostly to the five largest cultural organizations in the region. The big five are all located in Denver and most of the smaller groups are headquartered in the other six counties that make up the Scientific and Cultural Facilities District.
The SCFD board stuck by its earlier plan which gives only modest increases to the smaller groups, proclaiming that the process it used to come up with its proposal — relying on a board-appointed task force — was fair and inclusive.
The argument now moves to the state legislature, which must approve the plan, then on to voters who will be asked for their nod in November 2016.
Both supporters and opponents of the plan are already working with lobbyists to convince their state representatives to back their positions.
There's a lot at stake in terms of tangible support for the arts. The SCFD currently collects $52 million, which it distributes to 278 groups who provide music, theater, and science education. That amount — collected through a 1-cent on $10 sales tax — is expected to grow to $88 million by 2030 when the next reauthorization period would end.
